segments.pli: “Katinaṃ nu kho, bhikkhave, indriyānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā khīṇāsavo bhikkhu aññaṃ byākaroti:
segments.en: “Mendicants, how many faculties must a mendicant develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmī”ti?
segments.en: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’?”
“Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”

segments.pli: “dvinnaṃ kho, bhikkhave, indriyānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā khīṇāsavo bhikkhu aññaṃ byākaroti:
segments.en: “A mendicant must develop and cultivate two faculties so that they can declare enlightenment.

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmīti.
Ariyāya ca paññāya, ariyāya ca vimuttiyā.
Yā hissa, bhikkhave, ariyā paññā tadassa paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: For their noble wisdom is the faculty of wisdom.

segments.pli: Yā hissa, bhikkhave, ariyā vimutti tadassa samādhindriyaṃ.
segments.en: And their noble freedom is the faculty of immersion.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ indriyānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā khīṇāsavo bhikkhu aññaṃ byākaroti:
segments.en: These are the two faculties that a mendicant must develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmī”ti.
segments.en: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’.”

suttaplex.blurb: Having developed wisdom and immersion a mendicant may declare their awakening.
